results.title: A Harsh New Reality for Afghan Women and Girls in Taliban-Run Schools
results.abstract: Afghanistan’s new government is likely to severely restrict education for girls and women despite the Taliban’s claims that schooling will eventually resume.
results.byline: By Victor J. Blue and David Zucchino

multimedia.caption: “When we think about our future, we can’t see anything,” said one 17-year-old girl. A class in Kabul last week.

results.title: From Hero of ‘Hotel Rwanda,’ to Dissident, to 25-Year Prison Sentence
results.abstract: The trial of Paul Rusesabagina, whose story was portrayed in the Oscar-nominated movie, was denounced by human rights advocates as a “show trial” intended to silence critics of Rwanda’s president.
des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

multimedia.caption: Paul Rusesabagina arriving at court in Kigali, Rwanda, last October. He was tried on nine charges, but has refused to attend his trial since March and did not appear for the verdict on Monday.

results.title: Deported by U.S., Haitians Are in Shock: ‘I Don’t Know This Country’
results.abstract: Haitians who lived abroad for years have been returned to a country in crisis that they barely recognize — often, they say, without a hearing.
